summary: Between FY 2015-2021, the federal government spent billions of dollars on disaster assistance. Disaster costs are projected to increase as certain extreme weather events like drought or floods become more frequent and intense due to climate change. Enhancing the government's climate resilience—planning and preparation for potential climate hazards—can help it reduce potential future losses. title: Climate Change: Enhancing Federal Resilience
